TopicTitle: Elon Musk in "The Simpsons" newest episode

Articles.Content:
Apparently he is becoming more and more famous.

http://www.theverge.com/2015/1/26/7904897/elon-musk-debunks-electric-rockets-after-simpsons

If u saw @TheSimpsons and wonder why @SpaceX doesn't use an electric rocket to reach orbit, it is cuz that is impossible
- Elon Musk's Twitter
Elon Musk on Twitter: Final one: anything launched by a railgun (if you could ever reach ~ Mach 27) would explode upon exiting the barrel in our dense atmosphere 3:28 AM - 26 Jan 2015
The Simpsons must end. They have been on air for so long that almost anything that could be done on the show was already done. So, its basically more of the same.

The Simpsons must end. They have been on air for so long that almost anything that could be done on the show was already done. So, its basically more of the same.

Jeb has not been on it yet....

Anyway, still happy they featured him. I think Musk himself liked it too.

Though I think they should've studied more how he speaks IRL. Too bad he himself couldn't voice act due to his vocal problems

The Simpsons must end. They have been on air for so long that almost anything that could be done on the show was already done. So, its basically more of the same.

Does that not also mean that if you cancel the Simpsons because they did everything, you must also cancel almost every other show? Most shows have roughly the same point of departure.

Too bad he himself couldn't voice act due to his vocal problems

Explain please?
Does anybody actually watch the Simpsons at this point?

Does anybody actually watch the Simpsons at this point?

Good question. Every new commercial that I've seen looks like they are jumping the shark in new and tedious ways, and they all look terrible.

Anyway, still happy they featured him. I think Musk himself liked it too.

Though I think they should've studied more how he speaks IRL. Too bad he himself couldn't voice act due to his vocal problems

Poor guy. What's up??

Also, Jeb needs to be on The Simpsons. They're running out of famous people to feature so badly, I could be on it in a few years. (Well, I made the local papers in 2 counties once...)

Explain please?

If you watch any interview with Elon, you'll notice how often he stutters/stammers. This is sadly a very common problem for many people(1 in 100 adult males have this), it's roots lead back to the early stages of childhood where the person suffered through a traumatic experience, or it is passed on genetically. At this age, it would be very hard for him to overcome this problem even with the help of a doctor. Perhaps in his daily life, he stammers very rarely. This happens more often when the person is experiencing stress.

Edit: Just realized he himself was invited to do the voice acting.

Edited February 1, 2015 by SpaceXray

Does anybody actually watch the Simpsons at this point?

Not me. I've seen some of the new episodes and they are pretty bad. It seems that someone should end their misery.
